comment: Everything is on Aleks, so try to complete everything because if not you will fail and she does not give lectures. Lockdown & webcam are required and she will take off points if you do not set up correctly so just beware. If you fail the exam and had a b/c in the class you will fail the class. Precalc is already hard and plenty work so do your best

Had her for pre-calc. Very difficult class. Loads of work, more than all my other classes combined. That said, it's really more of a problem with how much content there is to cover packed into the class. The professor was really helpful as far as online classes go. She would be available in GroupMe and respond pretty quickly. Uses Aleks.

Class was extremely hard. She doesn't teach, no lecture videos. Only given Aleks videos that do not explain a lot at all. Formula sheets are not even worth it since it is 1 page and the one recommended by Aleks for this class is 6 pages. Had to hire a tutor for $55 an hour and still failed. Extra credit was not worth it for the work put in.
Her guidelines were very clear, she follows her syllabus to the tea so make sure you read that. She will not make any exceptions even with reasoning, to have late grades.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: You're essentially teaching yourself. This is an Aleks course. Not a taught course. She reviews (not teaches) the text book in weekly videos and uses group me to answer any questions you have. The rest is just up to you and Aleks to learn the content. If you're ok with this then you'll be fine.

This class was all on aleks, she does use lockdown browsers with webcam! I should've ended with a C but she rounded me up to a B:) (I failed every test and never used the textbook) . Do the homework on time and do good on the tests and you're set. Everything is set and lined up just do the work and you'll be good.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: She is really nice and care about her students.  She gave us a lot of videos where to watch the activities or problems. You basically gonna teach yourself. She's crazy about lockdowns, but provides you with index card for test and gives partial credit. Good enough for me!

Lots of homework, but you'll be fine if you start early. She gives tests with 9-13 questions, but the final had 30 questions. I recommend studying before taking a test. Provides study guides that have questions similar to the tests. She also gives partial credit on all tests, including the final. Replaces your lowest test grade with the final.

This class was definitely difficult. Prepare for A LOT of work with the test being extremely short, so one question wrong will drop your grade a lot. Professor Greenberg overall was very easy to reach out to and understanding of difficulties. Also helped with extra credit on the test. But I definitely would not recommend math online if you struggle

Make sure you finish all the homework assignments on alek . If you can do the homework assignments then you will do well in the class because the test is the same type problems as the homework problems

Professor Vicki is a decent professor. I took this class online and it was A LOT OF WORK. I did pretty well overall, but it was taxing. LOTS of extra credit but beware very short tests!! She is intimidating over email but responds quickly. ALEKS IS A PAIN. One bad assignment grade can push you back a TON. If you are good at math, take her.
this class is on Aleks, she is insane about lockdown browser. Must show hands and submit work after, if you mess anything us she will take 20% off.
This class is so boring its not even funny. All we do is aleks assignments online and tests. Not anything else. Ugh
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Awesome teacher! Very structured teacher and is very helpful and engaged with her students. You can really tell she wants her students to do well in the class.

Great teacher. Class and grading structure is predictable which makes studying much easier. I haven't taken a College Algebra in 20 years and I'm getting an A+ so far. Definitely putting in effort to achieve that grade. This is the first win I've ever had in Math in my life. Would definitely recommend her and wished she taught Calculus.

Professor Greenberg is very nice and helpful. My class only met once a week so attendance was not mandatory. If you're having trouble with homework material she will help if you go to class. Take her. The material is a little difficult. But she will walk you the whole way. Take her. Seriously.

This class was one of the easiest college classes I've taken.  Professor Greenberg gives you specific due dates, is extremely prompt when emailing back, and is very helpful in trying to make her students understand the material.  I highly recommend taking this class

I just want to say that Vicki's video demonstrations for these concepts were INVALUABLE to me. I have referenced them countless times when I took a break between Math levels and needed refreshers. Hybrid course, so her lectures honestly I didn't even pay much attention to. Her videos combined with MML saved my butt!

Professor Greenberg is a nice lady, but I found it hard to follow along in her class. She does posts videos & notes for the course, in attempts to get u to understand & follow along. But I felt like it wasn't enough. The examples felt rushed. She uses MML, so there's a lot of homework to do. If you're not that great in math, I don't recommend her.

Hybrid class. The days where we did meet, she spent about 10 mins actually teaching then dismissed class. When she does teach, she goes really fast and expects students to be math majors or something. Lots of assignments bc KSU requires my math lab.

Took her as a hybrid class. She's really nice and sweet. She's always smiling. Everything is basically online.  She's very helpful if you don't get math. Just stay on top of the assignments online and you'll do fine.

If you're not good at math or like me it's been years since you practiced it I don't recommend her. I spent hours trying to understand what she was explaining in her videos & in-class time was optional and not helpful. Her grading system is different than most & may favor you(I was supposed to get 34% on my 1st exam and her curve turned it to 53%)

Awesome professor! Watch her videos online. They are slow, but just fast forward when you need to. Class time was used for questions over HW. Quizzes are online and you can take each of them twice. Tests are in class and you're allowed a note card. There are extra credit opportunities and if you have an A in the class you can exempt the final.

She was nice, and the work wasn't too hard, but sometimes her video lectures were unclear. She didn't review much in class on the days we met. However, she was very good at answering emails about homework problems. You must be very dedicated and be on top of your work to succeed.
Worst teacher! Tries to make things difficult. She might change her methods because of receiving bad feedback in class.

I am someone who in not very good at math and thanks to her teaching style I received a B in this class. I took her hybrid class and the lessons she puts online are great! She allows you to take your quiz over if you don't like your first grade and she also allows a note card on the test. She was more than happy to answer any questions I might had.

Her class is not easy for someone who is bad at math, as I was. But I must say that all the hard work I put in this class paid off when I made an A in pre-calc and calculus. Take her if you need a real refresher in math. Do the work in MML every day to keep up, show up to all the classes, and you'll get an A. Optional final if u get As on all tests
She wasn't very helpful.

A very sweet woman and makes the class friendly. The quizzes are difficult but if you study the results they prepare you for the test. Also, if you completely your homework on mymathlab daily you should understand the material. Click 'view an example' with your homework if your notes aren't clear. I'd take her again, this class was easy.

She is not a horrible teacher, but she does skip steps when working out math problems and expects everyone to know what she did. Also the quizzes are extremely hard, in my opinion they are much harder than the tests, but the tests are hard too, not what we learned in class.My math lab sucks.U get an attendance grade and it replaces your lowest quiz

She's okay. She is very helpful if you go to her one on one. Her examples in class are very easy but it is different when it comes to the test. Her quizzes are easy, if you have a good background in math. If you SUCK at math; dont take.

Avoid this professor if you can!! Doesn't explain new concepts clearly and skips important steps "just because". Math is the kind of subject where you cannot afford to skip steps.  Tests are filled with questions that are not taught in class.  I would have failed if I didn't have access to mymathlab.  Do not take!

Worst math teacher ever. Although she goes over notes in class, they do not correlate to the quizzes or the tests. She explains the easiest possible example, then gives tests and quizzes that have insanely difficult problems. She also oftentimes does not explain the concepts. I learned more from mymathlab than Victoria Greenberg. Do not take.
Provides Note sheets that she goes over each class period so you can use them for a study guide.  She likes MathLab but I did not.
